trans-unit.source: Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations
trans-unit.target: Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations

trans-unit.source: A call to a Blob service API can include a server timeout interval, specified in the <codeInline>timeout</codeInline> parameter of the request URI.
trans-unit.target: A call to a Blob service API can include a server timeout interval, specified in the <codeInline>timeout</codeInline> parameter of the request URI.

trans-unit.source: If the server timeout interval elapses before the service has finished processing the request, the service returns an error.
trans-unit.target: If the server timeout interval elapses before the service has finished processing the request, the service returns an error.

trans-unit.source: The maximum timeout interval for Blob service operations is 30 seconds, with some exceptions noted below.
trans-unit.target: The maximum timeout interval for Blob service operations is 30 seconds, with some exceptions noted below.

trans-unit.source: Apart from these exceptions, the Blob service automatically reduces any timeouts larger than 30 seconds to the 30-second maximum.
trans-unit.target: Apart from these exceptions, the Blob service automatically reduces any timeouts larger than 30 seconds to the 30-second maximum.

trans-unit.source: The following example REST URI sets the timeout interval for the <link xlink:href="1a1d2a8e-de2b-4fa8-9d6d-582998a26a4f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Containers</link> operation to 20 seconds:
trans-unit.target: The following example REST URI sets the timeout interval for the <link xlink:href="1a1d2a8e-de2b-4fa8-9d6d-582998a26a4f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Containers</link> operation to 20 seconds:

trans-unit.source: The following operations implement exceptions to the standard 30 second timeout interval:
trans-unit.target: The following operations implement exceptions to the standard 30 second timeout interval:

trans-unit.source: Calls to get a blob, get page ranges, or get a block list are permitted 2 minutes per megabyte to complete.
trans-unit.target: Calls to get a blob, get page ranges, or get a block list are permitted 2 minutes per megabyte to complete.

trans-unit.source: If an operation is taking longer than 2 minutes per megabyte on average, it will time out.
trans-unit.target: If an operation is taking longer than 2 minutes per megabyte on average, it will time out.

trans-unit.source: Calls to write a blob, write a block, or write a page are permitted 10 minutes per megabyte to complete.
trans-unit.target: Calls to write a blob, write a block, or write a page are permitted 10 minutes per megabyte to complete.

trans-unit.source: If an operation is taking longer than 10 minutes per megabyte on average, it will time out.
trans-unit.target: If an operation is taking longer than 10 minutes per megabyte on average, it will time out.

trans-unit.source: The maximum timeout to write a block list is 60 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The maximum timeout to write a block list is 60 seconds.

trans-unit.source: A container that was recently deleted cannot be recreated until all of its blobs are deleted.
trans-unit.target: A container that was recently deleted cannot be recreated until all of its blobs are deleted.

trans-unit.source: Depending on how much data was stored within the container, complete deletion can take seconds or minutes.
trans-unit.target: Depending on how much data was stored within the container, complete deletion can take seconds or minutes.

trans-unit.source: If you try to create a container of the same name during this cleanup period, your call returns an error immediately.
trans-unit.target: If you try to create a container of the same name during this cleanup period, your call returns an error immediately.
